ground_truth: The scene fades to black. In the garden, rain bounces off the abandoned dinner table where droplets plop into half-empty glasses of white wine. A candle flame flickers in a struggle to stay alight. Emily and Tim lie in each other's arms in bed. They caress each other's faces. She stares into his eyes. Tim strokes her arm as he stares into her adoring eyes. Emily plays gently with his ear, then lowers her eyes and lightly touches his lips with her fingertips. Emily stares at him earnestly. Emily looks tearful and puts her lips to his shoulder. A large tear rolls down Emily's nose. Tim hugs her to him. She buries her face in his chest. They kiss. The pulse in Emily's neck jumps rhythmically. Golden light bathes her face as she lies sleeping peacefully. Tim lies beside Emily, watching her closely. Emily's hand rests palm-up on the empty pillow beside her. She twitches slightly but doesn't wake. The scar on the upper part of her left breast shows just above the sheet. Tim, now dressed in his jeans, stands at her bedside and pulls on his polo shirt. Looking troubled, he stares down at Emily. Tim leaves the house by the French windows. He sets off slowly across the dark garden in the pouring rain, then jogs to the picket fence. He jumps over it. Tim runs frantically down a street of shops, some of which have neon-lit signs. Soaked to the skin, Tim bursts into a hospital corridor and strides down it to the nurses' station. The nurse eyes Tim warily. Looking fraught and agitated, Tim turns away from the nurses' station, paces a little and sits down on a chair beside a water cooler. He stares at the floor. Tim looks up when Dr. Briar enters the corridor and walks to meet her. She looks alarmed. Tim raises a hand helplessly, marches back along the corridor and pushes through the double doors. The hospital's main doors slide open. Tim walks out into the night. The rain cascades as a grief-stricken Tim strides away from the hospital. As he walks, he takes his mobile phone from his jeans' pocket and taps in a number. Dan and Michelle lie asleep in each other's arms. Dan reaches for the phone on his bedside cabinet. Tim rings off. Dan, now sitting up in bed, remains with the phone to his ear and drops his head. Tim returns to his motel room and pauses in the doorway. His expression is slightly glazed, as if consumed by his own sad thoughts. He turns and stares outside, then closes the door. Tim sits on the edge of his bed, panting. Regaining his composure slightly, Tim reaches for the phone on his bedside cabinet and makes a call.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The panorama dims to ebony. In the yard, precipitation rebounds off the deserted supper table where droplets splash into half-vacant goblets of ivory vino. A taper blaze wavers in a battle to remain ignited. Emily and Tim recline in each other’s embrace in bed. They fondle each other’s visages. She gazes into his eyes. Tim caresses her arm as he gazes into her affectionate eyes. Emily fiddles delicately with his auricle, then lowers her gaze and lightly brushes his lips with her fingertips. Emily gazes at him sincerely. Emily appears weepy and places her lips on his shoulder. A large droplet rolls down Emily's nose. Tim clutches her to him. She buries her visage in his torso. They smooch. The beat in Emily's neck leaps rhythmically. Amber light washes over her visage as she reclines slumbering serenely. Tim reclines beside Emily, observing her intently. Emily's hand reposes palm-up on the vacant cushion beside her. She twitches faintly but doesn't awaken. The cicatrix on the superior part of her left bosom exhibits just above the sheet. Tim, now attired in his denim, stands at her bedside and tugs on his polo shirt. Looking disturbed, he gazes down at Emily. Tim exits the domicile by the French windows. He departs slowly across the dim yard in the soaking precipitation, then trots to the picket barrier. He leaps over it. Tim sprints frantically down a thoroughfare of boutiques, some of which possess neon-illuminated signs. Drenched to the skin, Tim erupts into a medical center passageway and strides down it to the nurses' desk. The nurse regards Tim cautiously. Looking distraught and perturbed, Tim turns away from the nurses' desk, strides a little and sits down on a chair beside a water cooler. He gazes at the ground. Tim looks up when Dr. Briar enters the passageway and walks to meet her. She appears alarmed. Tim raises a hand helplessly, marches back along the passageway and pushes through the double doors. The medical center's principal doors slide open. Tim walks out into the night. The precipitation cascades as a mournful Tim strides away from the medical center. As he walks, he takes his mobile device from his denim pocket and taps in a numeral. Dan and Michelle lie slumbering in each other’s embrace. Dan reaches for the mobile device on his bedside bureau. Tim rings off. Dan, now sitting up in bed, remains with the mobile device to his ear and drops his head. Tim returns to his hostel chamber and pauses in the entryway. His countenance is slightly glazed, as if consumed by his own melancholic musings. He turns and gazes outside, then closes the door. Tim sits on the brink of his bed, breathing heavily. Regaining his composure slightly, Tim reaches for the mobile device on his bedside bureau and makes a call.

A candle flame is flickered in a struggle to stay alight. Emily and Tim are lying in each other's arms in bed. Each other's faces are caressed by them. His eyes are stared into by her. The dark garden is set off slowly across by him in the pouring rain, then he jogs to the picket fence. The fence is jumped over by him. Down a street of shops, some of which have neon-lit signs, Tim runs frantically. Soaked to the skin, a hospital corridor is burst into by Tim, and it is stridden down by him to the nurses' station. Tim is eyed warily by the nurse. Looking fraught and agitated, away from the nurses' station, Tim turns, paces a little and a chair beside a water cooler is sat down on by him. The floor is stared at by him. Tim looks up when Dr. Briar enters the corridor and is walked to meet by him. Alarmed, she looks. Helplessly, a hand is raised by Tim; back along the corridor, he marches and the double doors are pushed through by him. The hospital's main doors are slid open. Into the night, Tim walks out. As a grief-stricken Tim strides away from the hospital, the rain cascades. As he walks, his mobile phone is taken from his jeans' pocket by him, and a number is tapped in. In each other's arms, Dan and Michelle are lying asleep. The phone on his bedside cabinet is reached for by Dan. Off, Tim rings. Now sitting up in bed, with the phone to his ear, Dan remains and his head is dropped. Tim returns to his motel room and the doorway is paused in by him. Slightly glazed, as if consumed by his own sad thoughts, his expression is. The outside is turned and stared at by him, then the door is closed. On the edge of his bed, Tim sits, panting. Slightly regaining his composure, the phone on his bedside cabinet is reached for by Tim and a call is made.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The scene fades to black. Rain hits the garden's abandoned dinner table, droplets plopping into half-empty wine glasses. A candle flame flickers. Emily and Tim lie in bed, caressing each other's faces. She stares into his eyes; he strokes her arm and gazes back adoringly. Emily gently touches his lips, looks tearful, and a tear rolls down her nose as she kisses his shoulder. Tim hugs her, and they kiss. Golden light bathes sleeping Emily’s face, showing a scar above her breast. Tim dresses beside her, looking troubled. Leaving through French windows, Tim jogs through the rainy garden to a picket fence and jumps over. He runs down a street past neon-lit shops and bursts into a hospital corridor. Fraught, Tim paces before sitting by a water cooler. Dr. Briar’s entrance alarms him, and he leaves through the hospital's main doors into the rain, dialing a number. Dan and Michelle sleep as Dan picks up Tim's call but remains silent. Tim returns to his motel room, appearing lost in thought. After a pause, he closes the door, sits on the bed, and makes a call.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The scene fades. Rain hits the abandoned dinner table in the garden, droplets fall into half-empty wine glasses, and a candle flickers. Emily and Tim lie in bed, caressing each other's faces. Emily looks tearful, kisses Tim's shoulder, and a tear falls from her nose. Tim hugs her, and they kiss. Emily's neck pulses rhythmically, and golden light bathes her sleeping face. Tim, now dressed, looks troubled and leaves. He runs through the dark, rainy garden and jumps the picket fence. Tim frantically runs down a street with neon signs, enters a hospital, and strides to the nurses' station. Agitated, he paces, sits by a water cooler, and looks up when Dr. Briar enters. Tim raises a hand helplessly and leaves. Outside, grief-stricken, he calls Dan, who is asleep with Michelle. Dan answers, sitting up. Tim returns to his motel, pauses, and stares out before closing the door. He sits on the bed, regains composure, and reaches for the phone to make a call.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: The scene gradually fades into darkness, enveloping everything in a deep blackness. In the sprawling garden, rain falls relentlessly, its droplets bouncing playfully off the surface of an abandoned dinner table. These raindrops plop with a soft, rhythmic sound into half-empty glasses that still contain remnants of white wine. Nearby, a solitary candle flickers valiantly, its small flame struggling to hold its ground against the damp air. Inside, Emily and Tim lie intertwined in one another's arms in bed. They tenderly caress each other's faces, exchanging silent gestures of affection. She gazes deeply into his eyes, full of emotion. Meanwhile, Tim gently strokes her arm while he is captivated by her adoring eyes. Emily, with a gentle touch, plays with his ear, then lowers her gaze and delicately places her fingertips on his lips. Her earnest stare conveys a depth of feeling. As she becomes tearful, she presses her lips softly to his shoulder. A large tear forms and rolls slowly down Emily's nose. Tim pulls her closer, holding her tightly to him. She buries her face against his chest, seeking comfort in his presence. They share a kiss, and the pulse in Emily's neck thrums with a lively rhythm. Golden light cascades over her face as she lies in peaceful slumber. Tim remains beside her, watching her intently. Emily’s hand rests with its palm upward on the otherwise empty pillow beside her. She experiences a slight twitch but remains asleep. A scar is visible just above the sheet, on the upper part of her left breast. Tim, now clad in jeans, stands by her bedside and pulls on his polo shirt. His eyes, filled with trouble, gaze down at Emily. Tim exits the house through the French windows. He moves slowly at first across the dark, rain-drenched garden, and then breaks into a jog toward the picket fence. He leaps over it with determination. Tim runs frantically down a street lined with shops, some of which have neon-lit signs casting an eerie glow. Drenched to the skin, Tim bursts into the sterile environment of a hospital corridor and strides purposefully down it, heading straight for the nurses' station. The nurse gives Tim a wary, cautious look. Appearing fraught and agitated, Tim turns away from the station, paces back and forth, and finally settles into a chair beside the water cooler. His eyes fixate on the floor. When Dr. Briar enters the corridor, Tim looks up and walks swiftly to meet her. Her expression is one of alarm. Tim raises a hand in helplessness, then marches back down the corridor and forcefully pushes through the double doors. The hospital's main doors slide open with a mechanical hum. Tim steps out into the night, where the rain cascades down, and strides away from the hospital, his grief evident in every step. As he walks, he extracts his mobile phone from the pocket of his jeans and taps in a familiar number. Dan and Michelle, meanwhile, lie asleep in each other's arms. Dan reaches out for the phone on his bedside cabinet. Tim, having rung off, leaves Dan, now sitting up in bed, with the phone to his ear, his head dropping with the weight of the news. Tim finally returns to his modest motel room and pauses for a moment in the doorway, his expression slightly glazed, as if lost in his own sorrowful thoughts. He turns to gaze outside, and then closes the door with resignation. Sitting on the edge of his bed, he pants slightly, working to regain his composure. Slowly, Tim reaches for the phone on his bedside cabinet and places a call.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: The scene slowly and gracefully transitions into darkness, wrapping everything in a profound, velvety blackness. In the expansive, sprawling garden, the rain falls persistently, its droplets bouncing energetically off the surface of an unattended dinner table. These raindrops create a soft, rhythmic symphony as they gently plop into half-empty glasses that still cling to the remnants of white wine. Nearby, a solitary candle bravely flickers on, its diminutive flame valiantly struggling to remain alight against the oppressive, damp air. Inside, Emily and Tim are nestled together, intertwined in one another’s arms upon the bed. Their tender caresses intertwine with silent gestures of affection as they lovingly touch each other's faces. Emily gazes deeply into Tim's eyes, her gaze filled with heartfelt emotion. Meanwhile, Tim gently caresses her arm, mesmerized by her loving, adoring eyes. With gentle fingers, Emily plays with his ear, and then her gaze shifts down as she delicately places her fingertips upon his lips. Her earnest, sincere stare communicates a profound depth of feeling. As tears well up, she presses her lips softly upon his shoulder. A significant tear forms, rolling slowly and deliberately down Emily's nose. Tim draws her in closer, holding her tightly against him. She nestles her face against his chest, seeking solace and comfort in his presence. They share a tender kiss, and the rhythm of Emily's pulse beats with life in her neck. Golden light spills over her face as she lies in a peaceful, serene slumber. Tim remains by her side, watching her intently with an unwavering gaze. Emily’s hand rests palm-up on the otherwise empty pillow beside her. A slight twitch runs through her, yet she remains fast asleep. A scar is faintly visible, just above the sheet, on the upper part of her left breast. Tim, now wearing jeans, stands by her bedside and pulls on his polo shirt. His troubled eyes are filled with concern as he gazes down at Emily. Tim exits through the French windows of the house. Initially, he moves slowly across the dark, rain-soaked garden before breaking into a determined jog toward the picket fence, which he leaps over with determination. Tim rushes frantically down a street lined with shops, some adorned with neon-lit signs casting an eerie, otherworldly glow. Soaked to the bone, Tim bursts into the sterile environment of a hospital corridor and strides purposefully down its length, making his way directly to the nurses' station. The nurse regards Tim with a wary, cautious look, her eyes reflecting concern. Appearing fraught and deeply agitated, Tim turns away from the station, pacing back and forth before finally settling into a chair positioned next to the water cooler. His eyes fixate on the floor, lost in thought. When Dr. Briar enters the corridor, Tim looks up and walks swiftly to meet her. Her expression is one of alarm and concern. Tim raises a hand in a gesture of helplessness, then resolutely marches back down the corridor, pushing forcefully through the double doors. The hospital's main doors open with a mechanical hum. Tim steps out into the night, where the relentless rain cascades down, and strides away from the hospital, each step heavy with evident grief. As he walks, he extracts his mobile phone from the pocket of his jeans and taps in a familiar number. Meanwhile, Dan and Michelle lie asleep, embraced in each other's arms. Dan reaches out for the phone resting on his bedside cabinet. After Tim has rung off, Dan, now sitting upright in bed, remains with the phone pressed to his ear, his head heavy and bowed under the weight of the news. Tim finally returns to his modest motel room, pausing for a moment in the doorway, his expression slightly glazed, as if lost deep within his own sorrowful thoughts. He turns to cast a lingering gaze outside before closing the door with a sense of resignation. Sitting on the edge of his bed, he pants slightly, working to regain his composure. Slowly, Tim reaches for the phone on his bedside cabinet and initiates a call.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The scene gradually dims until complete darkness surrounds everything. In the garden, raindrops tumble down from the sky, hitting the surface of the abandoned dinner table with a rhythmic splatter, where the droplets accumulate and then descend into half-empty glasses that still contain traces of white wine. Nearby, a candle's flame flickers and dances unpredictably as it fights valiantly against the encroaching elements to remain lit. Inside, Emily and Tim are intimately nestled in each other's embrace in bed, their arms comfortably encircling one another. Emily gently caresses Tim's face, feeling the contours beneath her fingertips as she holds his gaze with unwavering intensity. In return, Tim tenderly runs his hand up and down Emily's arm, maintaining eye contact, absorbed by the adoration reflected in her eyes. Emily lightly plays with his ear, twirling it gently before lowering her eyes and allowing her fingers to brush delicately against his lips. Her expression becomes earnest as she continues to gaze at him, her eyes welling up with unshed tears. She leans forward, pressing her lips softly to his shoulder, and as she does so, a large tear escapes and slowly trails down from her nose. In response, Tim tightens his embrace, drawing her nearer, and she buries her face against his chest to seek comfort. Their lips meet in a tender kiss, and the rhythmic pulse in Emily's neck is visible, synchronizing with the golden light that bathes her serene, sleeping face. Tim lies beside her, his gaze fixated on her peaceful appearance. Emily's hand rests palm-up on the empty pillow next to her, twitching subtly in her slumber, yet she remains asleep. The scar on the upper part of her left breast peeks slightly above the sheet, a hint of its presence. Tim, now dressed in jeans, stands beside her and slips on his polo shirt, his expression clouded with worry as he glances down at Emily. Exiting the room, he leaves the house through the French windows, pausing momentarily as the pouring rain greets him. He begins to move slowly through the dark garden, the rain drenching him further, and transitions to a jog as he approaches the picket fence, vaulting over it with determination. In the next instant, Tim is sprinting frantically along a street lined with shops, some adorned with neon-lit signs casting eerie glows. Soaked entirely through to his skin, he bursts into the sterile atmosphere of a hospital corridor and strides with purpose toward the nurses' station, where he is met with a wary glance from a nurse. Agitation seeps through his demeanor as Tim abruptly turns away from the station, pacing in small circles before settling into a chair beside a water cooler, where he drops his gaze to the floor in contemplation. His attention shifts upwards as Dr. Briar enters the corridor, prompting him to intercept her path. She appears alarmed upon seeing him, and Tim, in a gesture of helplessness, raises his hand before decisively marching back down the corridor and pushing his way through the swinging double doors. The hospital's main doors slide open effortlessly to permit Tim's exit into the night. The rain continues to cascade around him as he strides away, a shroud of grief enveloping his movements. As he walks, he retrieves his mobile phone from his jeans' pocket, methodically tapping in a number. Elsewhere, Dan and Michelle are entangled in sleep, their arms wrapped around each other in comfort, when Dan reaches over to the bedside cabinet to pick up the ringing phone. Before he can respond, Tim ends the call abruptly. Dan, now sitting up in bed, remains with the phone pressed to his ear, his head bowed contemplatively. Tim eventually returns to his motel room, pausing at the threshold with a slightly glazed expression, as if lost in a haze of sorrowful reflections. He turns his eyes toward the outside world once more before decisively closing the door. He then perches on the edge of his bed, breathing heavily but evenly as he attempts to regain his composure. Calming slightly, he extends a hand to the phone resting on his own bedside cabinet and proceeds to make another call.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
The scene fades to black. In the garden, rain bounces off the abandoned dinner table, droplets plopping into half-empty glasses of white wine while a candle flame flickers in the struggle to stay alight. Inside, Emily and Tim lie in each other's arms in bed, sharing a tender moment as they caress each other's faces and gaze into each other's eyes. Emily gently touches Tim's lips and her own tearful face, which she then buries in his chest as they embrace and kiss. She falls asleep, bathed in golden light, while Tim watches over her. He eventually rises, dresses, and with a troubled expression, leaves the house through the French windows.

Tim crosses the garden in the pouring rain, jumps the picket fence, and runs frantically down a neon-lit street to a hospital. There, soaked and agitated, he heads to the nurses' station, paces nearby, and sits by a water cooler. Dr. Briar's arrival catches his attention, and after a brief exchange, Tim leaves the hospital, striding into the rainy night, visibly grief-stricken. He takes out his mobile phone and calls Dan, who is sleeping beside Michelle. Dan reaches for the phone, listening with a heavy heart as Tim hangs up.

Back at his motel room, Tim pauses in the doorway, consumed by his thoughts, before closing the door and sitting on the edge of his bed. He regains some composure and reaches for the phone to make another call.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The scene fades to black. In the garden, a place known for its vibrant roses and well-trimmed hedges, rain bounces off the abandoned dinner table where droplets plop into half-empty glasses of white wine, a vintage from a renowned vineyard in Napa Valley. A candle flame, sheltered under an ornate glass cloche, flickers in a struggle to stay alight. Emily and Tim lie in each other's arms in bed, a sanctuary they created together in their downtown apartment. They caress each other's faces, finding solace in the quiet intimacy they share. She stares into his eyes, which reflect the dim glow of the streetlights outside. Tim strokes her arm as he stares into her adoring eyes, a mirror of his own affection. Emily plays gently with his ear, then lowers her eyes and lightly touches his lips with her fingertips, a gesture they often shared during their long weekend getaways. Emily stares at him earnestly, her emotions laid bare. Emily looks tearful and puts her lips to his shoulder, a place she often sought comfort. A large tear rolls down Emily's nose, glistening like a diamond. Tim hugs her to him, feeling her warm breath against his skin. She buries her face in his chest, seeking the heartbeat that calms her. They kiss, a bittersweet farewell in the stillness of night. The pulse in Emily's neck jumps rhythmically, a sign of her deep emotional turmoil. Golden light, cast by the antique lamp on their nightstand, bathes her face as she lies sleeping peacefully. Tim lies beside Emily, watching her closely, as if memorizing every detail. Emily's hand rests palm-up on the empty pillow beside her, a silent testament to their shared dreams. She twitches slightly but doesn't wake, lost in dreams of a hopeful future. The scar on the upper part of her left breast, a memory of past battles, shows just above the sheet. Tim, now dressed in his jeans, stands at her bedside and pulls on his polo shirt, a familiar routine disrupted by his troubled thoughts. Looking troubled, he stares down at Emily, contemplating the uncertain path ahead. Tim leaves the house by the French windows, which overlook the lush, rain-soaked garden. He sets off slowly across the dark garden in the pouring rain, then jogs to the picket fence, a boundary they once painted together. He jumps over it with practiced ease. Tim runs frantically down a street of shops, some of which have neon-lit signs advertising late-night diners and convenience stores. Soaked to the skin, Tim bursts into a hospital corridor, where the sterile environment contrasts sharply with the chaos in his heart, and strides down it to the nurses' station. The nurse eyes Tim warily, accustomed to seeing distress in the late hours. Looking fraught and agitated, Tim turns away from the nurses' station, paces a little and sits down on a chair beside a water cooler, the hum of which fills the quiet hallway. He stares at the floor, his mind racing with unresolved fears. Tim looks up when Dr. Briar enters the corridor, a physician known for her empathy and expertise, and walks to meet her. She looks alarmed, sensing the gravity of the situation. Tim raises a hand helplessly, unable to voice his turmoil, and marches back along the corridor, pushing through the double doors to the waiting area. The hospital's main doors slide open with a whisper. Tim walks out into the night, where the rain cascades down, matching his grief-stricken demeanor. As he walks, he takes his mobile phone from his jeans' pocket and taps in a number, a lifeline to his closest friend. Dan and Michelle lie asleep in each other's arms, finding comfort in each other's presence. Dan reaches for the phone on his bedside cabinet, a device that often brings both news and distress. Tim rings off, unable to bring himself to speak. Dan, now sitting up in bed, remains with the phone to his ear and drops his head, sensing the unspoken crisis. Tim returns to his motel room, an impersonal space he rented during this difficult time, and pauses in the doorway. His expression is slightly glazed, as if consumed by his own sad thoughts, reflecting on the choices that led him here. He turns and stares outside, observing the distant city lights blurred by rain, then closes the door, seeking solitude. Tim sits on the edge of his bed, panting, the weight of the night pressing down on him. Regaining his composure slightly, Tim reaches for the phone on his bedside cabinet, ready to make a call that might bring some clarity or comfort.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: The scene fades to black. In the garden rain bounces off the abandoned dinner table where droplets plop into halfempty glasses of white wine. A candle flame flickers in a struggle to stay alight. Emily and Tim lie in each other's arms in bed. They caress each other's faces. She stares into his eyes. Tim strokes her arm as he stares into her adoring eyes. Emily plays gently with his ear then lowers her eyes and lightly touches his lips with her fingertips. Emily stares at him earnestly. Emily looks tearful and puts her lips to his shoulder. A large tear rolls down Emily's nose. Tim hugs her to him. She buries her face in his chest. They kiss. The pulse in Emily's neck jumps rhythmically. Golden light bathes her face as she lies sleeping peacefully. Tim lies beside Emily watching her closely. Emily's hand rests palmup on the empty pillow beside her. She twitches slightly but does not wake. The scar on the upper part of her left breast shows just above the sheet. Tim now dressed in his jeans stands at her bedside and pulls on his polo shirt. Looking troubled he stares down at Emily. Tim leaves the house by the French windows. He sets off slowly across the dark garden in the pouring rain then jogs to the picket fence. He jumps over it. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Tim runs frantically down a street of shops some of which have neonlit signs. Soaked to the skin. Tim bursts into a hospital corridor and strides down it to the nurses' station. The nurse eyes Tim warily. Looking fraught and agitated. Tim turns away from the nurses' station paces a little and sits down on a chair beside a water cooler. He stares at the floor. Tim looks up when Dr Briar enters the corridor and walks to meet her. She looks alarmed. Tim raises a hand helplessly marches back along the corridor and pushes through the double doors. The hospital's main doors slide open. Tim walks out into the night. The rain cascades as a griefstricken. Tim strides away from the hospital. As he walks he takes his mobile phone from his jeans' pocket and taps in a number. Dan and Michelle lie asleep in each other's arms. Dan reaches for the phone on his bedside cabinet. Tim rings off. Dan now sitting up in bed remains with the phone to his ear and drops his head. Tim returns to his motel room and pauses in the doorway. His expression is slightly glazed as if consumed by his own sad thoughts. He turns and stares outside then closes the door. Tim sits on the edge of his bed panting. Regaining his composure slightly. Tim reaches for the phone on his bedside cabinet and makes a call.

Emily looks tearful and puts her lips to his shoulder. A large tear rolls down Emily's nose. Tim hugs her to him. She buries her face in his chest. They kiss. The pulse in Emily's neck jumps rhythmically. Golden light bathes her face as she lies sleeping peacefully. Tim lies beside Emily watching her closely. Emily's hand rests palmup on the empty pillow beside her. She twitches slightly but does not wake. The scar on the upper part of her left breast shows just above the sheet. test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The scene fades to black. In the garden, rain bounces off the abandoned dinner table where droplets plop into half-empty glasses of white wine. A candle flame flickers in a struggle to stay alight. A squirrel and a book lie in each other's arms in bed. They caress each other's faces. The squirrel stares into its eyes. The book strokes its arm as it stares into its adoring eyes. The squirrel plays gently with its ear, then lowers its eyes and lightly touches its lips with its fingertips. The squirrel stares at it earnestly. The squirrel looks tearful and puts its lips to its shoulder. A large tear rolls down the squirrel's nose. The book hugs it to itself. It buries its face in its chest. They kiss. The pulse in the squirrel's neck jumps rhythmically. Golden light bathes its face as it lies sleeping peacefully. The book lies beside the squirrel, watching it closely. The squirrel's hand rests palm-up on the empty pillow beside it. It twitches slightly but doesn't wake. The scar on the upper part of its left breast shows just above the sheet. The book, now dressed in its jeans, stands at its bedside and pulls on its polo shirt. Looking troubled, it stares down at the squirrel. The book leaves the house by the French windows. It sets off slowly across the dark garden in the pouring rain, then jogs to the picket fence. It jumps over it. The book runs frantically down a street of shops, some of which have neon-lit signs. Soaked to the skin, the book bursts into a hospital corridor and strides down it to the nurses' station. The nurse eyes the book warily. Looking fraught and agitated, the book turns away from the nurses' station, paces a little and sits down on a chair beside a water cooler. It stares at the floor. The book looks up when a turtle enters the corridor and walks to meet it. It looks alarmed. The book raises a hand helplessly, marches back along the corridor and pushes through the double doors. The hospital's main doors slide open. The book walks out into the night. The rain cascades as a grief-stricken book strides away from the hospital. As it walks, it takes its mobile phone from its jeans' pocket and taps in a number. A banana and a shoe lie asleep in each other's arms. The banana reaches for the phone on its bedside cabinet. The book rings off. The banana, now sitting up in bed, remains with the phone to its ear and drops its head. The book returns to its motel room and pauses in the doorway. Its expression is slightly glazed, as if consumed by its own sad thoughts. It turns and stares outside, then closes the door. The book sits on the edge of its bed, panting. Regaining its composure slightly, the book reaches for the phone on its bedside cabinet and makes a call.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The scene fades to black. In the library, rain bounces off the abandoned chessboard where droplets plop into half-empty mugs of herbal tea. A lantern flickers in a struggle to stay alight. Emily and Tim lie in each other's arms on the sofa. They caress each other's faces. She stares into his eyes. Tim strokes her arm as he stares into her adoring eyes. Emily plays gently with his ear, then lowers her eyes and lightly touches his lips with her fingertips. Emily stares at him earnestly. Emily looks tearful and puts her lips to his elbow. A large tear rolls down Emily's cheek. Tim hugs her to him. She buries her face in his chest. They kiss. The pulse in Emily's neck jumps rhythmically. Silver light bathes her face as she lies sleeping peacefully. Tim lies beside Emily, watching her closely. Emily's hand rests palm-up on the empty cushion beside her. She twitches slightly but doesn't wake. The scar on the upper part of her left shoulder shows just above the blanket. Tim, now dressed in his khakis, stands at her side and pulls on his hoodie. Looking troubled, he stares down at Emily. Tim leaves the cabin by the sliding doors. He sets off slowly across the dark meadow in the pouring rain, then jogs to the stone wall. He climbs over it. Tim runs frantically down a street of stalls, some of which have neon-lit banners. Soaked to the skin, Tim bursts into a clinic hallway and strides down it to the reception desk. The receptionist eyes Tim warily. Looking fraught and agitated, Tim turns away from the reception desk, paces a little and sits down on a bench beside a vending machine. He stares at the floor. Tim looks up when Dr. Briar enters the hallway and walks to meet her. She looks alarmed. Tim raises a hand helplessly, marches back along the hallway and pushes through the revolving doors. The clinic's main doors slide open. Tim walks out into the night. The rain cascades as a grief-stricken Tim strides away from the clinic. As he walks, he takes his tablet from his khakis' pocket and taps in a number. Dan and Michelle lie asleep in each other's arms. Dan reaches for the clock on his bedside table. Tim rings off. Dan, now sitting up in bed, remains with the clock to his ear and drops his head. Tim returns to his apartment and pauses in the doorway. His expression is slightly glazed, as if consumed by his own sad thoughts. He turns and stares outside, then closes the door. Tim sits on the edge of his sofa, panting. Regaining his composure slightly, Tim reaches for the tablet on his bedside table and makes a call.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The scene brightens gradually. In the garden, wind rustles around the abandoned dinner table where leaves flutter into half-empty glasses of white wine. A candle flame dances in a struggle to stay upright. Emily and Tim sit in each other's arms in bed. They pat each other's faces. She glances into his eyes. Tim rubs her arm as he glances into her adoring eyes. Emily toys gently with his ear, then raises her eyes and softly traces his lips with her fingertips. Emily glances at him earnestly. Emily looks thoughtful and presses her lips to his shoulder. A large tear drips down Emily's nose. Tim squeezes her to him. She hides her face in his chest. They hug. The pulse in Emily's neck beats steadily. Golden light washes over her face as she lies resting peacefully. Tim sits beside Emily, observing her closely. Emily's hand lies palm-up on the empty pillow beside her. She shivers slightly but doesn't wake. The scar on the upper part of her left breast shows just above the sheet. Tim, now dressed in his jeans, kneels at her bedside and zips up his polo shirt. Looking pensive, he gazes down at Emily. Tim exits the house by the French windows. He moves slowly across the dark garden in the pouring rain, then saunters to the picket fence. He climbs over it. Tim walks briskly down a street of shops, some of which display neon-lit signs. Drenched to the skin, Tim bursts into a hospital corridor and marches down it to the nurses' station. The nurse watches Tim intently. Looking tense and agitated, Tim turns toward the nurses' station, steps a little and settles down on a chair beside a water cooler. He gazes at the floor. Tim looks up when Dr. Briar enters the corridor and approaches to meet her. She looks startled. Tim raises a hand awkwardly, strides back along the corridor and pulls through the double doors. The hospital's main doors swing open. Tim steps out into the night. The rain descends as a grief-stricken Tim paces away from the hospital. As he strolls, he takes his mobile phone from his jeans' pocket and types in a number. Dan and Michelle rest asleep in each other's arms. Dan reaches for the phone on his bedside cabinet. Tim hangs up. Dan, now leaning up in bed, remains with the phone to his ear and lowers his head. Tim returns to his motel room and halts in the doorway. His expression is slightly distant, as if lost in his own sad thoughts. He turns and looks outside, then shuts the door. Tim perches on the edge of his bed, breathing heavily. Regaining his composure slightly, Tim picks up the phone on his bedside cabinet and dials a call.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The curtain lifts to white. In the kitchen, snowflakes fall onto the forgotten piano bench where marbles clink into half-filled bowls of apple juice. A lantern's glow dances in a struggle to remain shining. Sarah and Jack rest in each other's shadows in the hammock. They trace each other's elbows. He gazes into her hands. Jack brushes her thumb as he gazes into her curious hands. Sarah fiddles gently with his nose, then raises her hands and lightly brushes his cheeks with her fingernails. Sarah gazes at him thoughtfully. Sarah looks cheerful and places her fingers to his knee. A large pebble slides down Sarah's cheek. Jack cuddles her to him. She hides her face in his elbow. They embrace. The rhythm in Sarah's ankle thumps gently. Silver light cocoons her hands as she rests sleeping soundly. Jack rests beside Sarah, eyeing her cautiously. Sarah's elbow rests palm-up on the vacant mattress beside her. She shifts slightly but doesn't rouse. The tattoo on the lower part of her right shoulder peeks just below the blanket. Jack, now dressed in his khakis, poses at her hammock and pulls on his turtleneck. Looking puzzled, he peers down at Sarah. Jack vacates the mansion by the sliding doors. He shuffles slowly across the illuminated courtyard in the drizzling snow, then skips to the garden gate. He leaps over it. Jack dashes frantically down a row of cafes, some of which have fluorescent-lit displays. Drenched to the core, Jack storms into a clinic hallway and marches down it to the reception desk. The receptionist surveys Jack cautiously. Looking bewildered and frantic, Jack turns around from the reception desk, shuffles a bit and collapses onto a bench beside a snack machine. He examines the ceiling. Jack glances up when Dr. Maple enters the hallway and strides to meet him. She appears startled. Jack raises a foot aimlessly, storms back down the hallway and shoves through the swinging panels. The clinic's revolving doors part open. Jack exits into the dawn. The snow showers as a sorrowful Jack strolls away from the clinic. As he wanders, he retrieves his calculator from his khakis' pouch and dials in a note. Tom and Linda snooze entangled in each other's elbows. Tom stretches for the note on his nightstand. Jack hangs up. Tom, now rising in the hammock, remains with the note to his eye and bows his forehead. Jack returns to his apartment room and halts in the archway. His demeanor is slightly dazed, as if preoccupied by his own melancholy imaginings. He spins and glares inward, then latches the archway. Jack perches on the rim of his hammock, wheezing. Regaining his calmness slightly, Jack stretches for the note on his nightstand and places a call.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The scene brightens to white. In the library, sunlight glances off the forgotten chessboard where shadows dance around pieces of black coffee. A lamp's bulb sways in a battle to stay lit. Oliver and Claire sit under an oak tree on the lawn. They tickle each other's hands. He narrows his gaze into her eyes. Claire pats his cheek as she giggles into his earnest eyes. Oliver fiddles carefully with her ring, then raises his eyes and lightly brushes her cheek with his knuckles. Oliver winks at her playfully. Oliver looks pensive and leans his head on her shoulder. A small smile spreads across Oliver's lips. Claire pats him on the back. He tilts his head on her lap. They laugh. The melody in Oliver's mind plays cheerfully. Silver moonlight caresses his face as he sits thinking deeply. Claire sits beside Oliver, humming softly. Oliver's foot rests heel-down on the empty space beside him. She shifts slightly but doesn't stir. The mark on the lower part of his right hip peeks just below the belt. Claire, now dressed in her dress, stands at his side and pulls on her cardigan. Looking relieved, she glances down at Oliver. Claire enters the cabin through the sliding doors. She heads off quickly across the dim hallway in the pouring rain, then sprints to the white gate. She rolls under it. Claire dances excitedly down a corridor of doors, some of which have brass nameplates. Drenched to the bone, Claire dashes into a museum gallery and glides down it to the curator's desk. The curator watches Claire skeptically. Looking joyful and animated, Claire spins away from the curator's desk, twirls a little and perches on a bench beside an art display. She gazes at the painting. Claire perks up when Ms. Willow appears in the gallery and rushes to greet him. He looks delighted. Claire waves a hand exuberantly, skips back along the gallery and skips through the revolving doors. The museum's main doors swing open. Claire skips out into the day. The sun shines as a joyful Claire dances away from the museum. As she skips, she takes her camera from her cardigan pocket and taps in a code. Sam and Laura sit chatting at a nearby table. Sam reaches for the TV remote on his side table. Claire signs off. Sam, now heading to the kitchen, remains with the remote in his hand and shakes his head. Claire returns to her beach hut and pauses at the entrance. Her expression is slightly serene, as if absorbed by her own serene thoughts. She pivots and gazes inside, then swings the door shut. Claire stretches on the sofa, yawning. Gaining her balance slightly, Claire retrieves the remote from the sofa cushion and turns on the TV.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The scene morphs into shadows. In the forest, snowflakes dance off the deserted picnic blanket where crumbs sink into half-eaten bowls of red soup. A lantern glow shivers in a quest to remain flickering. Emily and Tim sit in each other's arms on the bench. They trace each other's lines. She peeks into his eyes. Tim pats her shoulder as he peeks into her adoring eyes. Emily fiddles gently with his collar, then raises her gaze and softly brushes his cheeks with her fingertips. Emily gazes at him sincerely. Emily looks wistful and presses her forehead to his shoulder. A small tear drips down Emily's chin. Tim cradles her to him. She hides her face in his lap. They embrace. The pulse in Emily's wrist leaps steadily. Silver moonlight washes over her as she sits resting tranquilly. Tim sits beside Emily, observing her intently. Emily's hand lays palm-down on the vacant cushion beside her. She shivers slightly but doesn't rouse. The tattoo on the lower part of her right ankle peeks just above the blanket. Tim, now clad in his khakis, stands at her side and slips on his sweater. Looking pensive, he glances down at Emily. Tim exits the cabin through the sliding doors. He strides briskly across the dim forest in the falling snow, then sprints to the stone wall. He climbs over it. Tim jogs anxiously down a road of boutiques, some of which have spinning-lit displays. Drenched to the core, Tim dashes into a school hallway and saunters down it to the receptionist's desk. The receptionist studies Tim cautiously. Looking tense and restless, Tim turns away from the receptionist's desk, paces a bit, and settles down on a bench beside a plant. He gazes at the ceiling. Tim glances up when Dr. Briar enters the hallway and strolls to meet her. She looks startled. Tim raises a hand aimlessly, paces back along the hallway, and nudges through the swinging doors. The school's main doors swing open. Tim rambles out into the dusk. The snow swirls as a sorrowful Tim paces away from the school. As he walks, he extracts his compact mirror from his khakis' pocket and dials a number. Dan and Michelle rest entwined in each other's arms. Dan reaches for the book on his bedside shelf. Tim hangs up. Dan, now rising in bed, stays with the book to his chest and bows his head. Tim returns to his cabin and lingers in the threshold. His expression is slightly dazed, as if consumed by his own somber musings. He pivots and peers inside, then shuts the door. Tim rests on the edge of his bench, breathing heavily. Regaining his calm slightly, Tim grasps the book on his bedside shelf and pens a letter.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The scene brightens to white. In the stadium, snowflakes tumble onto the forgotten chessboard where flakes land into half-full bowls of green tea. A flashlight beam flutters in an attempt to glow steadily. Zoe and Sam sit in each other's hats on a sofa. They brush each other's shoes. He glances into her elbows. Sam pats her leg as he glances into her wondrous elbows. Zoe fiddles gently with his thumb, then raises her elbows and softly taps his cheeks with her knuckles. Zoe glances at him intently. Zoe looks joyful and places her cheeks to his elbow. A small river slides across Zoe's cheek. Sam nudges her onto him. She hides her elbows in his legs. They wave. The rhythm in Zoe's wrist beats sporadically. Silver mist cloaks her elbows as she sits running noisily. Sam sits beside Zoe, observing her distantly. Zoe's elbow rests fist-down on the full suitcase beside her. She flutters slightly but doesn't dance. The tattoo on the lower part of her right foot appears just beneath the blanket. Sam, now wearing his shorts, sits on her windowsill and pushes on his hoodie. Looking amused, he glances up at Zoe. Sam enters the circus through the barn doors. He zooms swiftly across the bright stadium in the gentle wind, then strolls to the stone wall. He slides under it. Sam crawls gleefully up a desert of trees, many of which contain candlelit lanterns. Dry to the bone, Sam whispers into a school library and tiptoes through it to the janitors' closet. The janitor eyes Sam eagerly. Looking calm and collected, Sam turns toward the janitors' closet, saunters a little, and stands down on a rug beside a soda machine. He looks at the ceiling. Sam gazes down when Mrs. Fern exits the library and glides to greet him. She looks asleep. Sam offers a foot happily, skips quietly along the library and swims through the swinging gate. The school's side gates swing inward. Sam dances in under the sun. The snow tumbles as an exhilarated Sam tiptoes toward the school. As he skips, he retrieves his calculator from his hoodie’s pouch and dials a letter. Alex and Laura sit running in each other's hats. Alex signals for the chalk on his overhead shelf. Sam signs off. Alex, now standing up in class, continues with the chalk to his knee and lifts his arms. Sam enters into his library suite and rests on the bookshelf. His expression is slightly focused, as if immersed in his own cheerful dreams. He drops and gazes inside, then opens the window. Sam stands on the top of his bookshelf, giggling. Losing his excitement slightly, Sam signals for the chalk on his headboard and writes an essay.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The scene shifts to an intimate moment between Emily and Tim in bed, sharing a tender exchange despite her tearful demeanor. Tim, troubled, dresses and leaves Emily sleeping peacefully. He crosses the garden in the rain, jumping the fence and running through the streets until reaching a hospital. Frantic, he enters and sits near a water cooler, visibly distressed. Dr. Briar arrives, prompting Tim to leave, overwhelmed with grief. Outside, he walks in the rain, calls Dan, who is with Michelle, but hangs up, leaving Dan concerned. Tim returns to his motel, absorbed in melancholy thoughts. Gaining some composure, he makes another call from his room.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order
test_cases.description: Tim reaches for the phone on his bedside cabinet and makes a call Regaining his composure slightly Tim sits on the edge of his bed panting He turns and stares outside then closes the door His expression is slightly glazed as if consumed by his own sad thoughts Tim returns to his motel room and pauses in the doorway Dan now sitting up in bed remains with the phone to his ear and drops his head Tim rings off Dan reaches for the phone on his bedside cabinet Dan and Michelle lie asleep in each other's arms As he walks he takes his mobile phone from his jeans' pocket and taps in a number Tim strides away from the hospital The rain cascades as a griefstricken Tim walks out into the night The hospital's main doors slide open Tim raises a hand helplessly marches back along the corridor and pushes through the double doors She looks alarmed Tim looks up when Dr Briar enters the corridor and walks to meet her He stares at the floor Tim turns away from the nurses' station paces a little and sits down on a chair beside a water cooler Looking fraught and agitated The nurse eyes Tim warily Tim bursts into a hospital corridor and strides down it to the nurses' station Soaked to the skin Tim runs frantically down a street of shops some of which have neonlit signs He jumps over it He sets off slowly across the dark garden in the pouring rain then jogs to the picket fence Tim leaves the house by the French windows Looking troubled he stares down at Emily Tim now dressed in his jeans stands at her bedside and pulls on his polo shirt The scar on the upper part of her left breast shows just above the sheet She twitches slightly but does not wake Emily's hand rests palmup on the empty pillow beside her Tim lies beside Emily watching her closely Golden light bathes her face as she lies sleeping peacefully The pulse in Emily's neck jumps rhythmically They kiss She buries her face in his chest Tim hugs her to him A large tear rolls down Emily's nose Emily looks tearful and puts her lips to his shoulder Emily stares at him earnestly Emily plays gently with his ear then lowers her eyes and lightly touches his lips with her fingertips Tim strokes her arm as he stares into her adoring eyes She stares into his eyes They caress each other's faces Emily and Tim lie in each other's arms in bed A candle flame flickers in a struggle to stay alight In the garden rain bounces off the abandoned dinner table where droplets plop into halfempty glasses of white wine The scene fades to black
